text: María Corina Machado Parisca (born 7 October 1967) is a Venezuelan politician and industrial engineer. She was a member of the National Assembly of Venezuela from 2011 to 2014. She is known as an opposition politician and critic against the Hugo Chávez and Nicolás Maduro presidencies. Machado was the founder and former leader of the Venezuelan volunteer civil organization Súmate. In 2018, she was listed as one of BBC's 100 Women. She unsuccessfully ran for President of Venezuela in 2012 and 2024. ==Early political career== During her early political career, she was a critic of President Hugo Chávez. Machado was a candidate in the 2012 presidential election but lost the opposition primary to Henrique Capriles. During the 2014 Venezuelan protests, Machado was one of the lead figures in organizing protests against the government of Nicolás Maduro. ==2024 presidential election== She was a precandidate for Vente Venezuela in the primary elections of the Unitary Platform of 2023, although on 30 June 2023 she was disqualified for fifteen years from running for office. Her disqualification was confirmed by the Supreme Court of Justice of Venezuela in January 2024. After winning the primary elections, Machado was named the opposition candidate for the 2024 presidential elections, though she was replaced by Corina Yoris on 22 March 2024. Yoris was prevented from registering as a candidate and was temporarily replaced by Edmundo González Urrutia. ==References== ==Other websites== *Official Súmate website *Maria Corina Machado's Flickr photostream *2010 Election website Category:1967 births Category:Living people Category:Venezuelan politicians Category:People from Caracas
title: María Corina Machado
